titlestmt.titleproper: Friends of the Smith College Libraries Oral History Project, 1977-1982

did.head: Collection Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Friends of the Smith College Libraries Oral History Project

did.unittitle: Friends of the Smith College Libraries Oral History Project
did.abstract: This collection reveals the memories about Smith College by several faculty, students, and staff ranging from the early twentieth century through mid twentieth century using oral history.

bioghist.p: The Friends of the Smith College Library was formed in March 1942 to assist the Smith College Library's collection of material. In the 1977 fall meeting of the Committee of the Friends, the Oral history project was approved, and Gertrude Smith (1928) Professor Emeritus of Music, coordinated the task of recording "the recollections and reminiscence of retired members of the faculty and administrative staff who live in the Northampton area" (1976-1977 Annual Report). According to the annual reports, there were a total of 38 tapes; however, not all have survived.

scopecontent.p: The tapes range from personal recollections about being a student, staff, or faculty member at Smith to wider social and political issues of the times. The tapes record various changes in Smith College's landscape- the razing of buildings as well as changes in curriculum, departments, and staff. Gertrude Smith's summary provides a concise overview, highlighting key topics on each tape and noting whether the tape is single or double sided.
The following tapes mentioned in Smith's summary were never added to the collection:

list.item: Establishing the Archives and Sophia Smith Collection, Feb. 10, 1977
Helen Hills Chapel and Religious Life, May 31, 1977

scopecontent.p: It is unclear whether the Ada Comstock Scholars tape does have a separate recording of Alice Dickinson with Eleanor Rothman and a group of Ada Comstock Scholars or whether the record of Eleanor Rothman with Adas Susan Donovan-Yarde (1980), Lorna Maclachlan (1980), and Phyllis Paige (1980) is the same record. The summary suggests the later.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Friends of the Smith College Libraries Oral History Project, Tape #, Smith College Archives

acqinfo.p: The Friends of the Smith College Libraries Oral History Project tapes were donated after the project was completed in 1983.
